framework.interfaces

Interface Input

  • All Superinterfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Camera, Triangle

    public interface Input
extends processing.core.PConstants
    Interface for giving an coursework object input handling. Any class you want to have input handling should implement the Input interface. e.g. public Class implements Input

    Methods will be called from a Scene renderer to give input from keyboard and mouse

    Version:
    1.0.0
    11 Sep 2015
    Author:
    wil
    See Also:
    Camera

    • Method Detail

      • handleKey

        void handleKey(char key,
               int state,
               int mX,
               int mY)
        Called when keyboard input is received from ASCII characters.

        key constants: ENTER, RETURN, TAB, BACKSPACE, ESC, DELETE

        Note: check for RETURN and ENTER for cross-platform operability.

        Example implementation: 

                void handleKey(char key, int state, int mX, int mY){
            if (state == 1){ // if key pressed down
                switch(key){ // ASCII char
                    case 'A':
                    case 'a':
                        parent.translate(-1.f,0.f,0.f); // go left
                        break;
                    case 'D':
                    case 'd':
                        parent.translate(1.f,0.f,0.f); // go right
                        break;
                    case ENTER:  // Windows and Linux
                    case RETURN: // Mac OS X
                        // operation for using enter/return key
                        break;
                }
            }
        }
        Parameters:
        key - ASCII character from keyboard input
        state - 1 if key down, 0 if key up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleSpecialKey(int keyCode, int state, int mX, int mY)

      • handleMouse

        void handleMouse(int button,
                 int state,
                 int mX,
                 int mY)
        Called when mouse is clicked up / down in the rendering window

        button constants: LEFT, RIGHT and CENTER

        Parameters:
        button - mouse button (LEFT, RIGHT or CENTER)
        state - 1 if mouse down, 0 if mouse up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleMouseDrag(int mX, int mY), handleMouseMove(int mX, int mY)

      • handleMouseDrag

        void handleMouseDrag(int mX,
                     int mY)
        Called when mouse is moved in rendering window while mouse button is held down
        Parameters:
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleMouse(int button, int state, int mX, int mY), handleMouseMove(int mX, int mY)

      • handleMouseMove

        void handleMouseMove(int mX,
                     int mY)
        Called when mouse is moved in rendering window when no mouse button is pressed
        Parameters:
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleMouse(int button, int state, int mX, int mY), handleMouseDrag(int mX, int mY)

      • handleSpecialKey

        void handleSpecialKey(int keyCode,
                      int state,
                      int mX,
                      int mY)
        Called when keyboard input is received from special (non-ASCII) characters.

        keyCode constants: (arrow keys) UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, ALT, CTRL, SHIFT, PAGE_UP, PAGE_DOWN, HOME, END

        Example implementation: 

                void handleKey(int keyCode, int state, int mX, int mY){
            if (state == 1){ // if key pressed down
                switch(keyCode){ // special key
                    case LEFT:
                        parent.translate(-1.f,0.f,0.f); // go left
                        break;
                    case RIGHT:
                        parent.translate(1.f,0.f,0.f); // go right
                        break;
                }
            }
        }
        Parameters:
        keyCode - coded keyboard input based on KeyEvent
        state - 1 if key down, 0 if key up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleKey(char key, int state, int mX, int mY)
